Reviews.Title: “Convenient and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: cm9720
Reviews.Content: Contemporary Hotel located close to the aIrport. Rooms are large and very clean. The whole hotel has a very modern feel to it. Breakfast included an extensive selection of cereals and continental style food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, a bit far”
Reviews.Author: jasantunes
Reviews.Content: The hotel design and decor are gorgeous. It's a very comfortable hotel. They also provide a airport shuttle for free (email them beforehand). The downside is the location. We had to catch a bus + subway to get to town. However, the transportation is fairly good and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: robseet
Reviews.Content: The employee are exceptionally helpful, we arrived earlier than our check-in time, as we travel with kids and infant we are kinda tired from the early flight we took. The receptionist help us to hasten the cleaner that prepare our room so that we can check in earlier, while waiting she usher us to wait at the second floor game room where my son got to play nintendo wii to keep him occupied. To get to Madrid city centre, you have to take a bus and then change to a metro. We traveled with children but we found that it was not too troublesome. All bus are equiped with free wifi, it only took around 20mins max to reach a bus station with connecting metro. Food wise, there is no restaurant nearby, you either eat in the hotel or you can buy food from Makro which is very nearby (but you would be deny entry if you are not a Makro member). It had connecting shuttle bus from and to the airport, so getting to the airport is easy and very near.

Reviews.Title: “Ikea meets Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: NMtravelertoo
Reviews.Content: By all means, this is a great overnight before an early flight. Rooms are functional and clean. Boarding pass printers were down though and there was no evidence that anything would be done about it. I went nextdoor to the Feria's sister hotel to get ours. The breakfast is downright terrible, but is something to fill your stomach until airport or airplane food. The shuttle is reliable, but don't forget to reserve your morning trip to the airport or you'll be left behind. Price is comparable to other airport hotels with a shuttle, but I think you can do better with Clement Barajas or Tach Hotel for about the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “A "cold experience"...”
Reviews.Author: luispi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern, minimalist, and cold. It took their courtesy shuttle 1 hour and 10 minutes to pick us up from the airport terminal - even though they advertise the bus runs the terminal circle every 30 minutes. We called the hotel 4 times to advise we were waiting, and yet the bus driver told us he was unaware of our predicament (indeed, he blamed "the hotel" as if it were some foreign entity)... Because of the delay, we were not able to use their restaurant (it was closed by the time we checked in), and there was no other eatery open nearby. Only the personnel at the bar gave us some support offering chips and nuts.(They were nice!) At check out time, we went through a highly impersonal and mechanical experience. There was not even a "Thanks!" not even eye contact, nor a request for any feedback. I have stayed in several other hotels nearby (Clement, Tryp, etc.), and I will go back to them in any future opportunity. Now, in all fairness, the rooms are nice, modern and clean - although they offer basically no toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “A nice 3-star”
Reviews.Author: Aigna
Reviews.Content: Stayed one day between the flights.Suprisingly,the free shuttle bus was working ideally - after 10 minutes of waiting it arrived,and I had no problem booking it for the airport the next day. Rooms are clean and cosy,and quite big for the Europe.It's only the thin walls,that might bother you,everything else is really good - the business center,that allows you to work on the computer and copy/print,the helpful frontdesk. There's no restaurant for evening,but you can do it in the building next door - a 4 star also an Axor hotel. It was funny to find a Wii-room in the hotel. The location is not really good,far from metro,but you can have a bus around the corner,which takes you to the station,and back to the hotel - through the airport(go to the airport metro station and take that free shuttle bus outside).a bit tricky,but not that bad

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this one.”
Reviews.Author: ElQuesoGrande
Reviews.Content: If you have to spend the night at Madrid's Barajas airport, I suggest you try the Hilton or the Holiday Inn or a similar hotel. Although we were there in March, we arrived on a particularly hot day (global warming?) Despite our entreaties, we were told the a/c was not working because it was winter. It worked in seasons, not according to the temperatures inside and outside. Additionally, the televisions were rigged to only go so loud, and we had to sit one foot from the screen to hear anything. Maybe it was because of the paper-thin walls. Eating was accomplished either by going to the sister-hotel next door or going to a shopping area about fifteen minutes walk away. All in all, I think you can do better if staying at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoaoF
Reviews.Content: The Axor Feria (3***) is located very close to Madrid Barajas airport and it's an excellent option for a one night stay in case you have an early or late flight. The hotel is new (I was there in March 2012), very modern, good looking and clean. A kind of a no-frills hotel but confortable enough: room and bathroom were big, bed was very confortable and it had a big lcd. The only no was noise isolation: verg poor in case you have some noisy neighbours. Buffet breakfast available in the hotel (overpriced). Lunch and dinner on the "sister" Axor 4**** hotel which is side by side (have not tried it). There's a big shopping mall at 10 min walk. There'a shutle from and to the airport (5-10 min drive) every half hour. Make sure you book your return because a lot of people use it. Will use it again in the future, no doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and magnificent design”
Reviews.Author: D V
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night before taking a flight to my next destination the morning after. The location is very convenient. The staff is kind and helpful. The rooms are very nice put together in this spanish style "design hotel". The breakfast is very nice and complete. The special room rate I got included internet and parking, very convenient and I'm sure there's not a better deal with the hotels around the airport. I'm completely satisfied with my stay and will definetly come back if I'm by Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “RECEPTION HAD ATTITUDE!”
Reviews.Author: Ken and Val Q
Reviews.Content: Reception at 01-Hotel Axor Feria 3 Madrid on 2 February 2012. Having driven from Santander in very bad weather I (Val) and a girlfriend decided to stop in Madrid. On checking Bookings.Com on my friends phone we were told that there were 5 double rooms available at this hotel. We drove straight there arriving around 1900. At reception a Raquel Fernandez abruptly informed us that the hotel was full. We returned to our car and went back to Bookings.com on the Iphone to be told that there were still rooms available at this hotel. We therefore booked our room online taking the booking confirmation back into the hotel reception. We were then told by the same person that "it is impossible"! Raquel Fernandez then went into the office and spoke with someone, came back and said "now is possible". If the weather had not been so bad we would have gone elsewhere. The management of this hotel should be aware of how customer guests are being treated by this unhelpful receptionist. The rest of the hotel staff were very good and we enjoyed a comfortable and pleasant stay of one night.'

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for overnight stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: DyJohnnY
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife, stayed here for less than 24 hours. We just wanted a place to "crash" after a transatlantic flight, then take the airplane back home. First we were surprised that we had a free airport shuttle to the hotel, which meant getting to the hotel took 10 minutes, in 20 minutes we were in the room, unwinding from the flight. The rooms were very nice, modern furnishing, big bathroom and shower. One thing we did find odd was that there were not toiletries, instead a message, saying we can request them at the reception if we need any. We didn't need anything so that was ok. Room heating was very good, windows were very large, we had some kind of view (room 434) and we would open the window for some fresh air. We had internet in the room, I used Ethernet, and I had no problems with it, just plug and surf. On each floor the hallway has some "theme" to it, one is a business center, in one you could use laptops of the hotel, one was a "wiizone", one was just a relaxation area. The decorations were very modern, which was a nice change from our other hotels we visited. Our room price had breakfast included, which was good for us as we had a flight at 10 a.m. There is nothing to complain about this, except perhaps that they had only scrambled eggs on the buffet (or perhaps they had other varieties, and we missed them somehow). The staff was very helpful and polite. The location of the hotel is 1km from a shopping mall, where you can go on foot, and you find all the major fashion stores (this was a boon for my wife) if you want to do a little shopping. All in all we would definately stay here again, especially for short durations, the only disadvantage to visiting madrid is that it is not close to city center, and travel by public transport probably takes a bit longer than you might need, other than that, fits the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Carolinev89
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Madrid are so expensive - so we booked a few nights here and took the free airport shuttle to ride the metro into the centre. Think it definitely aided our budget because the shuttle is free and tourist passes cheap. It's nice and clean, with lots of laptops for you to use if you haven't brought your own. It's also round the corner from a massive shopping centre (if you arrive on Saturday, just follow the traffic jam and it'll take you to the car park). It's Spain so it's not open on a Sunday. I booked this because it was cheaper than the Axor Barajas next door - but I really couldn't see any difference in the lobby, and I can't imagine the rooms are that different because the buildings seemed to mirror each other. Also, there wasn't much to be improved upon. Overall - very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected”
Reviews.Author: Carol M
Reviews.Content: Extremely convenient, close to the airport, 30 min from Madrid City, modern look, beautiful rooms with WiFi access. Free Shuttle. Nothing bad with breakfast, and next is the Axor Barajas where you can enjoy excellent dinner at the restaurant. I would stay at the hotel again and again. Personnel is also kind and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: chunkofin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several hotels close to Madrid Airport and this one is absolutely superb and one of the best. We arrived about 8pm and booked in for a meal in the Axor Barajas next door. The meal was excellent. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from a large shopping centre if you have time for a quick shop!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mikael S
Reviews.Content: Good service, is close to the airport and you can use the shuttle every half hour. is a little far from the city center, so you have to take a bus and the metro to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniente, confortable, muy buen valor.”
Reviews.Author: dgaspar
Reviews.Content: Estamos muy satisfechos con la estadia en el Axor Feria.Consideramos que hemos elegido muy bien este Hotel en el Aeropuerto. LLegamos de Roma a la 9 p m y a los 25 minutos de espera llego el shuttle que nos llevo al Hotel. Aparentemente el shuttle funciona muy bien. Una de las razones para elegir este Hotel fueron los buenos comentarios sobre el Shuttle. La recepcion, amplia y de bella arquitectura. Los empleados muy amables. Las habitaciones son amplias, luminosas, y confortables, muy bien decoradas modernas y espectaculares. Con nevera. El bano tambien es nuevo, con muy buena ducha y radiador calienta toallas. Todo impeccable. La mañana siguiente el desayuno muy completo con huevos revueltos, bacon, etc. El shuttler de regreso al Aeropuerto para el vuelo a Miami, muy bien, a tiempo, cada media hora. Regresaremos a este Hotel de pasar nuevamente por Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Axor Feria”
Reviews.Author: allengeoff
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very convient to the airport, the staff and the shuttle bus driver were very helpful. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice and the price good. We shall also be returning early January on our return from Malaysia.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Choice for an Airport stay”
Reviews.Author: ultimatehotelguide
Reviews.Content: The Axor Feria is situated on a road next door to its 4 star sister hotel the Axor Barajas, just round the corner from the Plenilunio Shopping Centre which has a big selection of shops, a supermarket and a load of bars/restaurants which have a great choice (Chinese, Brazilian, Italian, American, Kebab, Salad bar, and various international fast food places) I arrived using the hotels free shuttle bus (collects from all terminals at set times every 30 mins from 0500 till 0100 ish) Checked in relatively quickly and went to my room. Having booked a non smoking double I got to my room which was a twin. Went down to reception and they said I could have either non smoking, or a double. This was annoying as I did book in advance. But they swapped me to the double room, and after a few hours with the window open (whilst i went for dinner) the room was well aired. Room: It was well appointed with a fridge, desk, in room safe, good hanging space for clothes, and the rooms where pretty spacious. Bathroom was great, with a massive walk in shower, with amazing water pressure. It was better than a power shower, and the shower head was a massive ceiling one, or a hand held one. Also Free Wifi in hotel rooms and communal areas. I did hear the people in the next door room on one evening, but it was a slight mumble, and was not that bad. The bed is fairly comfortable, but it is sheet and blankets, not duvet which i'm not personally keen on. I have stayed in the Axor Barajas as well before, and the Feria offers very similar accommodation identical bathrooms (minus the posh toiletries) but everything is just one click less at the Feria, hence the 3 star. I would happily stay at either again, but it would be price dependant as I see little major differences between the two. Both are an excellent choice for a night before heading to the airport. Hope this helps, safe travelling

Reviews.Title: “Convienient location close to airport and shopping”
Reviews.Author: VegardA
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Axor Feria before leaving Spain. Clean, modern and inexpensive. A free airport shuttle bus was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissH91
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a night. The room is so nice and the bed is really nice. The hotel is places in a really nice quarter. We went to the commercial center which were really nice also :D A few years ago I stayed in the sister hotel "Axor Barajas Hotel" which has 1 star more but i really couldn't see the different. Both of the hotels are amazing but if you can save some money i would diffinetly coose Axor Feria! They both have a shuttle bus to the airport. But ofcourse you should only choose this hotel if you have a flight the next day. If you want to visit Madrid you should choose another hotel which are some near the centrum :)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Larry034
Reviews.Content: Axor Feria is an excellent choice for travelers to Madrid. The hotel is clean and modern with a very accommodating staff. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and well-appointed. Complementary wi-fi is available throughout the hotel and there are 2 separate locations where computers are available for guests' use. There is even a computer, complete with printer, dedicated for online airline check-in and boarding pass printing. The complimentary shuttle service is reliable and the bus is clean and comfortable. A major shopping mall, the Plenilunium, with over 200 shops and restaurants is just 2 blocks away. Catch the bus at the end of the block and switch to the metro which will take you to the city center for 1.5 euro. Reception clerks Adriana and Tania were especially helpful with information and suggestions. All of this for about 50 euros per night, our cheapest lodging during 30 travel days in Europe

Reviews.Title: “very good 3 star hotel, but avoid the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SwitzerlandDuffy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good, very close to Barajas and they have a regular shuttle service. The rooms are good size and modern, the hotel is designed beautifully with lots of sitting areas and also computer stations everywhere. stay here with confidence. just avoid the restaurant at the next door axor barajas hotel, this is the only restaurant nearby. the room is ghastly, much too light. on top of that, the food was dreadful, service uncaring and it spoilt the evening. but the hotel is absolutely fine, just bring food with you or call dominos!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: conundrumz
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and modern. Very comfortable beds. Great bathroom. Excellent free breakfast. Highly recommended. One caveat: This hotel is convenient to the Madrid airport but the hotel shuttle only runs until midnight. We arrived after midnight and had to take a taxi for 15 Euros to the hotel. The taxi driver was surly and rude. Not the hotel's fault for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal to be near airport.”
Reviews.Author: canary09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a few minutes from Barajas and has a free shuttle. The rooms are large, bright, comfortable. Computers available to use, refrigerator, the best shower ever and a heated towel bar. The bus stop is up at the corner to connect with #77 to catch metro to the center. I would definitely stay there again for airport convenience. For a budget traveller it was a terrific deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an overnight stay!”
Reviews.Author: Grapta
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it offered free shuttle services from and to the airport and free wi fi, and it really met all my expectations, everything went well, the shuttle from the airport was prompt and the next morning was very punctual too. Good wi fi connection during the night we stayed, room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: BackpackerNoMore62
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one night on our return trip to the USA from Morocco. We flew into Madrid in the evening and were schedule to fly our the following morning, so we wanted a hotel that was near the airport and which provided an airport shuttle. We choose the Axor Feria for those two reasons and also because of price (about US$80) and the pictures on the internet. We were delighted by the cleanliness and sensible design our our room, and the generosity of the included breakfast impressed us. We would have loved to linger over the fruit juice, fresh pastries, ham, bacon, scrambled eggs, coffee, etc., but the timing of our flight forced us to eat in a hurry before leaving for the airport. One word of advice about the airport shuttle. The shuttle seems to run on a regular schedule every half hour. Going from the hotel to the airport presented no problem because we had to reserve our place the night before our departure. However, when we traveled from the airport to the hotel, we had to wait at least that long before we got picked up, and my inability to figure out how to use a public phone at the airport gave us a good deal of uncertainty after our arrival. There were many others waiting for the shuttle, which serves both the Axor Feria and the Axor Barajas (which is next door). The van holds about 20 people, and it was completely full, which raises the possibility of having to wait even longer if lots of people arrive at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KirkinKailua
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel close to the airport to spend the night and this hotel did not disappoint. Upon arrival at Madrid's Barajas Airport, we were promptly picked up by the free hotel shuttle and after about a 10 minute drive, we were at the hotel. There are actually two hotels on the property, and we had to walk just a few steps to the Axor Feria Hotel upon arrival. The room is very comfortable, with a nice bathroom and great shower. Lot's of room for luggage and closet space to hang things. Breakfast is served downstairs but if you want lunch or dinner, you must go to the sister property next door. We had lunch there and it was very good. I can recommend the sauteed pork loin! It was very good! If you need a nice hotel near the airport, I can recommend this one. It's clean, quiet, modern, and close to the airport. It was everything that we needed for our overnight stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Dacougr32
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel a 10min drive from Airport. Hotel has a free shuttle to/from airport every 30min which is great and free WIFI in room. Also hotel rate was very reasonable for Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - you don't feel like you're near the airport”
Reviews.Author: tuscany08NewZealand
Reviews.Content: We were so glad we booked this lovely hotel it made transitting the next day a breeze! They have a sister hotel next-door where we enjoyed a drink in the bar on the night of our arrival. After dinner we went for a walk around the neighbourhood there were restaurants down the street and a shopping mall within easy walking distance and you couldn't hear aircraft at all. We didn't feel like we were near an airport. The rooms were very modern (as their website shows) with every comfort. A super large shower and all the little extras. Breakfast was amazing, especially that Spanish bacon!! Can fully endorse all the great comments of other reviewers. Our courtesy shuttle the following morning was on time and very efficient. This is a super hotel. Jacqui & Mike New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Bad from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Daoda2
Reviews.Content: There are two hotels of the same company right next to each other, one three star, one four. When we arrived with the hotel bus the driver gave no information so I just assumed the hotel we were at was mine. After waiting 15 minutes to get to the desk as there was only one person handling check-ins I was told I was at the hotel next door. Go next door and wait another 15 minutes. Finally get to room. I needed a convertor for my laptop. Go down to desk. They don't have any which was shocking since the majority of their clients must be foreign tourists. I suggest calling next door. The guy couldn't be bothered and suggested I walk over. I did and was told they'd already given out the few they kept at the desk. Service was indifferent or rude from start to finish. Can't even remember how the room was now.

Reviews.Title: “one more satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: nd2trvmore
Reviews.Content: i chose this hotel based on TA reviews and was very glad i did. immaculately clean room - comfortable bed - great shower. front desk staff helpful, courteous, multi lingual and exceptionally professional - kudos to the HR and training departments. morning breakfast staff are a delight and the food an excellent value. with one exception, the shuttle staff did a great job - one early morning driver, a large fellow who was obviously capable, couldn't bring himself to load or unload passengers bags - its ok, he's the only one i didn't tip! be sure to make a reservation when outbound. one thing to consider with this fine hotel - although an easy connection to Plaza Mayor - center of the historic district - it can take up to an hour each way by public transportation. if your the kind of person who wants to run back for an afternoon nap before going back out, you will be committing a large portion of your day to travel - and 12 euros for two round trips. you can buy a book of tickets if the math works out. personally, i like to load up on the great breakfast, spend the day wandering the streets of old Madrid and end up at Mercardo San Miguel - just off the Plaza Mayor - for a reasonably priced, wide selection of tapas and raciones at 25 different stalls. DO NOT MISS the olive guy - even if you don't like olives!! in Hawaii we would say " it will break the face, brah"!! this excellently priced and exceptionally well staffed hotel is well with your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJH106
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Axor Feria because I was just flying in and out of Madrid and wanted somewhere with a free hotel shuttle that was reasonably proced. Great hotel and I highly recommend-I got the prepaid web special for 56Euros, which was a great price for a clean, smartly decorated room with a spacious bathroom (shampoo and body wash were indeed provided, but not in little bottles, but in a dispensor in the shower), comfy bed, plenty of towels, a TV, quiet and a very helpful staff. The airport shuttle was easy (and more importantly, free!) and it was located a few blocks from a large mall, so I was easily able to find a quick dinner and pick up a few plane snacks at the grocery store. They also have several laptops with free internet and you can print your boarding pass for free as well. I would definately be willing to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Last stop”
Reviews.Author: cheritorcan
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for location next to the airport and the price. In addition, they offered a shuttle to the airport starting at 5am. Breakfast may have been included but we left long before opening. A three star hotel, they did not provide shampoo but instead there were computers to use free of charge, which was far more valuable to us.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Yolmac
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it is close to the airport for our flight home. It was an excellent choice. There is a shopping centre just around the corner with many good shops and many eateries. Modern hotel with fresh furnishings and good sized room. Free Wifi is a great bonus. Breakfast provided a good selection to choose from for any nationality. Free shuttle from and to the airport is great especially if you have a connecting flight with an overnight stopover. Nice, clean and quiet hotel, although I was surprised to see they allow dogs in the hotel, something we Re not used to. Still would stay again if we return to Madrid and would gladly recommend if you want a hotel that is close to Barajas Airport. Only con would be that you are dropped off next door at the Axor Barajas hotel by the shuttle bus and you have to go back next door to catch the shuttle bus back to the airport, but this was not a big issue. Also although breakfast is held in the dining room at the Feria, the evening restaurant is only at the Axor Barajas hotel, so you have to go next door if you want to eat at the restaurant, but we ate at one of the eateries at the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the Airport!”
Reviews.Author: BA777236
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern, spacious and for the price very good value. The shuttle is generally very good, I did not have the same problems as some reviewers on here have. In particular, the shower is excellent and plenty to watch on the TV if you get bored. Also, very close to the Plenilunio shopping centre which has everything you could need during your stay! The breakfast is decent, maybe lacking a little in the hot food selection.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: JonsTravels11
Reviews.Content: free shuttle from airport was quick and easy, front desk lady very unfriendly wouldn't stop talking to her friend the whole time she was checking me in. room very nice , clean , modern , very large bathroom and very fair price.close to shopping and restaurants. would deffinatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good!”
Reviews.Author: andra_m_10
Reviews.Content: Very close of the airport, and next to Compostela Suites, which i wrote in a previous review. Free shuttle service, which can take you from/at the airport, but you need to book it. Rooms are modern, clean and big, bathroom is big as well. I didn't liked that there was no possible to check in in the morning, but they keept our luggages and we went to visit Madrid - we came back by the eveining and checked in. Shuttle is available only on certain hours, not all the time, so in the morning we had to leave by taxi, which is about 15 euros to Barajas. Free internet in all the hotel, wi-fi and games space, restaurant that looked nice, but we had no time for all this. If you need to be close of the airport, but still with easy acces in the town, is a nice place to stay. We left our luggages at the hotel, get the shuttle and went to the airport, and from there the metro to the town, and it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to be close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: fastturtle
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel to be close to the airport for an early morning flight and it provides a shuttle service. What a nice surprise. The room was wonderful and the bathroom was extremely modern. We had dinner at the hotel next door and it was outstanding. Definitely would recommend this hotel if you need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: SunnyRock
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok for a quick sleep on the way to the next destination. Rooms are clean but also cold and not welcoming. Overall OK

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Airport”
Reviews.Author: Traveler7010
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for airport travel with free shuttle. Clean modern large rooms including the bathroom with a great shower. Hard to find if you are driving. Suggestion, drop the rental car at the airport and take the free shuttle bus back to the hotel. Breakfast does not start to 7 AM and you can request a bag breakfast earlier but no coffee available before 7 AM. Be sure to reserve a place on the shuttle to the airport as it fills up. Good value for Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for going to or from the airport”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodDuo
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for going to or from the Madrid airport. As long as that is all you are doing I can highly recommend this place. It is clean, modern, large rooms, comfortable beds. Staff are friendly as well. However, if you are looking for a hotel to stay in to tour the actual city you definitely should NOT stay here. It is way far outside the city and there are plenty of good options near the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: Ben E
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 1 night on September 25, 2011. The hotel is modern and clean. The rooms are spacious, modern and clean. The price is excellent. The hotel provides a free shuttle service to and from the airport which is a must. The location is terrible. It is located near the airport but in an industrial area. There are no cafes, restaurants or shops nearby. To get to the center of the city you have to take the shuttle back to the airport and take the metro to town. Near by a 10 minute walk there is a big shopping center with a huge food court but you have to ask how to get there. Remember on Sundays all the stores including supermarkets and pharmacies are closed. It is an excellent hotel if you plan to stay one night between flights.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful check-in cost it 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Dirgette
Reviews.Content: I really wish I could write a positive review for this hotel. I booked it on the back of the other tripadvisor reviews and because of its proximity to the airport. The rooms are large and clean, the whole hotel has a modern feel, the staff are polite and helpful, the free shuttle service came in handy and all for a very reasonable price. BUT, for some unknown reason, the reception staff took 2 hours to check us in to our room. Our flight landed at 11:00 pm, and we only got into our room at 1:45 am.(we had to get up at 6:00 am!). A large group of people trying to check in seemed to somehow confuse the staff, although I'm sure as an airport hotel, they're used to checking in large groups. I would still recommend the hotel, and just hope that the check in incident was a one off..

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay by barajas airport”
Reviews.Author: Tacande
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, practical, modern in design, has a good price for the lot. You get free wifi, satelite tv and free transfer from and to the airport. I always stay in this hotel before a long flight the next day. It has the best relationship price- quality of the whole lot of hotels near Barqjqs, and I have used a few. Besides, there is a huge shopping mall near it called Plenilunio.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Manhattanhopeful
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our transit to Morocco. Ended staying longer than planned on the return leg due to hurricane Irene. This hotel is next to it´s twin, Axor Barajas. Hard to notice the difference between the two. There is a shuttle to and from the airport every 30 minutes. The hotel is clean and modern. Rooms and washrooms are decent sized, with modern fixtures and finishing. There are two internet stations available (lobby and second floor), with a total of 8 laptops available for guest use. There are also two to three areas for lounging and relaxation throughout the hotel.There is a restaurant in both buildings, with buffet breakfasts for $10 euros. Standard fare: eggs, toast, bacon, pastries, juice, fresh fruits, coffee etc. They also serve lunch and dinner, but I found the selection limited. Though the hotel seems like it is located in an area somewhat isolated from the hustle of Madrid, the area has it´s own strengths. About 10 minutes (walking) behind the hotel is a massive four-storey shopping center called Mercadona. There is a large food court, arcade, cinema (Spanish of course) and retail stores in the mall. Just outside the center is a bus stop with a direct connection to the Cannilejas metro station. That in turn will take you directly to downtown Madrid (Gran Via station). This station is where Puertal Del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Royal Palace and cosmopolitan shopping is all located. The bus came within 10 minutes everytime we went, and we reached Cannilejas within another 10 minutes. Gran Via is a 20 minute metro ride. Total cost per person (one way) is $3 euros. Easy on the wallet, considering the taxi is about $20 euros. Oh, and the taxi´s are located in front of the hotel! If you need further information on transit, send me a message or respond to this. I recommend this place to any traveller looking for a comfortable, dependable hotel while on transit.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle Service Terrible”
Reviews.Author: AndersonGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Axor Feria on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews on August 15, 2011 before returning to the U.S. The hotel itself was very nice, room pristine, best shower EVER, breakfast wonderful, great cyber spot as well. However, be warned that the shuttle service between the hotel and airport was abysmal. Their vans were poorly marked (one not at all, said Gran Classe on the outside with no indication it was for the Axor Feria, and when it finally arrived (after waiting 45 minutes and passing up the unmarked van) we were told it was full and we'd have to wait for another (this after calling the hotel when we landed asking where to get the shuttle and how long we would have to wait). We reserved our spot on the shuttle to take us to the airport the following morning and we were first on the shuttle. The driver took us to Terminal 4 where everyone got off (except us who needed Terminal 1). The driver started shouting at us and literally threw our bags back onto the shuttle and told us he asked everyone which terminal they needed and that the response was Terminal Four. Well, he should have asked after everyone was on the van. I speak Spanish and explained that we had not heard the question because we were already on the van out of earshot. That did not seem to placate the driver. He took us to Terminal 1, but was very obviously angry about it. We had a wonderful 2-week trip to Spain and this last experience with the shuttle for Axor Feria was extremely irritating and disappointing. We did not deserve being shouted at and I would not stay at the hotel again, if I had to contend with the poor shuttle service from Barajas airport. It was completely unacceptable. Axor should consider another shuttle outfit to serve their guests. This was truly unfortunate for us, and in the end for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern and efficient.”
Reviews.Author: jakb7
Reviews.Content: Chose it on the basis of other reviews in tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed, if you're in a car you need a TomTom to find it, the street layout in that part of Madrid is ultra complicated...and then the TomTom leaves you about 100metres short and as the hotel is set back you can't find it. The hotel is modern functional but it is very,very clean. The rooms aren't that big but the bathrooms are excellent. The worst thing about our room was the air conditioning, It was very noisy. The staff were very helpful but we thought the prices in the restaurant were too high. There's a shopping mall with loads of restaurants about 10 minutes walk away. The free airport transfer service was very efficient and the underground parking very convenient. Excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean but basic and a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: zeus751
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in late April 2011 along with my 14 year old son. We were visiting Spain with his soccer team for a 10 day training session at the Real Madrid training complex. The hotel was an easy commute to the airport. The staff was always friendly and very helpful. Most spoke good enough English to communicate with me since I speak no Spanish. The decor is very modern. The hallways were very dark due to the dark walls and the energy saving lights that lit up as you approached. A bit spooky but the hotel was very safe and comfortable. The rooms also had a very modern decor, almost to a fault. I had a queen size bed while the boys had two twin beds in their rooms. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and the flat panel TV was in good working order. The room was very clean and maintained well every day. There was a closet and a safe. There was free WiFi in the room although it was average quality. Surfing the internet seemed to be okay but I tried to use it to make calls using Skype and I kept losing the internet connection. They also had some restrictions on their configuration and I could not use Netflix on my computer. There was breakfast downstairs every morning and there many choices. They had eggs, cereal, donuts, breads, cheeses, fruit and cold cuts. The eggs were a bit funky but i think that was more of a cultural thing than a quality issue. We had lunch at the sister hotel next door and again, the food was very good. The service at the restaurant was very good and they were very quick to accommodate a vegetarian request as well. There is a mall within a 10 minute walk, which provides everything from grocery shopping to gifts to bring home, as well as a movie theater and several restaurants. We found ourselves there several times as there was nothing else to do around within walking distance. The hotel does a couple of sitting areas on each floor with TVs, one with video games. This allowed to watch a soccer game as a group on a nice size TV. There is also an internet bar in the lobby with laptops for use by the guests. Some vending machines offering sandwiches, snacks and drinks but they are overpriced. Overall, it was very good experience and i would stay there again but only for the sake of being with the rest of the team or maybe if I was there for a night or so, otherwise I would choose a hotel closer to the center of Madrid so I could walk around and experience the city more easily.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EleesPerth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous. A little bit outside of Madrid city but perfect for those wanting to stay out of the centre or even something close to the airport (5 mins drive). There is a free shuttle bus that goes to and from the airport which is extremely handy (a cab can cost up to 20 euros.) The rooms were absolutely gorgeous and the bathrooms were big and very well equipped. Would have to be one of the best hotels I stayed at in Europe and the price was fabulous. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: ClaraW13
Reviews.Content: I went there the night before my flight. The shuttle works well, the room was very clean, comfortable and looked great, like the whole hotel. It is perfect if you need to be to the airport soon the next day, but I would not stay there to visit Madrid because it is off-centered.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great - dinner was awful.”
Reviews.Author: mndrittenhouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a "triple" room and it was very clean & comfy. We got there late & wanted to eat. The dining room was overpriced and the food was undercooked. You had to pay for parking below ground but the area wasn't like you could find anywhere else to park - it should have been free for hotel guests. Front desk staff were very helpful. Breakfast cost 8 euros. Otherwise we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: Rosa0622
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable. Loved our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Gelat0
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to the Madrid airport and provided a shuttle service to the airport. We were surprised to discover that it was a beautiful modern hotel with large, spacious, modern well-equipped rooms. The staff was extremely helpful and their sister hotel, Axor, which is right next door, has a great restaurant. The best news was that the room rate was very reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel , far from the center, has I airport shuttle for free..”
Reviews.Author: JuliaTom
Reviews.Content: With my boyfriend drove in two weeks the whole of Spain, Barcelona, Madrid, Alicante, Burin, Valencia ... Valencia was the most beautiful:) sun, beach, old town, in Madrid just two days - is enough hotel - modern, clean , cool decor, free airport transfers (useful for early flights), friendly staff, we had no luck because we got on a rainy day and Easter, everything is closed from Easter Thursday Good breakfast but expensive. Nearby there is nothing to explore or to eat, you have to go to the center watch out on houskeeping - come into the room without knocking early in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Teribel
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel since it is close to the airport and provide fee shuttle to and from the airport. Everything worked out fine even though our flight delayed for 1.5 hours to 2 hours and by the time we arrived it was almost midnight, we were able to catch the last shuttle bus which came passed midnight at 12:30 p.m. and picked us and some other guests up after we called and advised the hotel of our flight being delayed. The hotel staff was courteous. We believe they are quite fully booked and they upgraded both of our rooms to Axor Bahaja next door at no additional costs and we were thrilled when we entered our room as it is so spacious and modernly decorated. Our teenage boy and my friends' kids loved the bunks and find the interior so cool and asked if we could stay longer. The room is nice and clean, just too bad that we only stayed for two nights. We will definitely go back to this same hotel if we have a chance to go to Spain again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a stop-over”
Reviews.Author: mns09
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 1 night. For an airport hotel it is clean, modern and reasonably priced. Shuttle bus worked perfectly in the morning but does stop running at a certain time in the evening and if you arrive after this be prepared to be scammed by the taxis - it took nearly 15mins to arrive at the hotel from the airport, taking the long way round to run up the fare. This only became apparent when it took less than 5mins for the shuttle bus to get us back the next day! Would use again on a similar stop-over but if visiting Madrid for a weekend or longer would stay closer to town as the Metro trip is about 40mins.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: saragosa0131
Reviews.Content: got stuck in Madrid for an extra week due to Volcano clouds and along with other fellow strandee's fro Edinburgh was put up here for 4 nights. The Hotel itself was reasonably clean etc but as far as how we were treated in terms of being fed and watered etc, it was nothing short of a disgrace. We were fed in the sister hotel next door and each mealtime we were segregated from the rest of the diners and sat at a crappy table and fed the same set meal every day and night and it was horrible. The staff also could not get us out the dining area quick enough and I witnessed staff on 3 occasions trying to remove a diners plate when he was clearly still not finished. Although there was some sort of deal done between the hotel and easy jet regarding our accomodation and food it was still disgraceful how we were treated and I and my fellow guests also got the feeling that had we been Spanish guests we would never have been treated in this manner. We also had to deal with two attempts by staff to charge us for a meal after hotel staff made a mistake one night and seated us at a different table, all highly embarrassing. Not a good end to what initially had been a nice trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, functional, close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: hamalua
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and more spacious than I expected. The bed was also larger than I expected. I liked the fact that there was no carpeting. Felt cleaner that way. The shuttle to/from the airport was one of the reasons I booked with this hotel. Unfortunately, the shuttle driver to the hotel was less than satisfactory. The bus was already full and so my suitcase had to go to the very top of the pile of suitcases on the back. I had to help him do that and when we got to the hotel, when unloading, he almost dropped it on me. Fortunately, the driver to the airport was much better. It took a while for the shuttle to leave for the airport since there were a total of 3 buses which were completely full. The breakfast buffet was ok and good enough before heading out to the airport. The only other negative I have is that I found a used bar of soap next to the faucet in the bathroom and the toilet was not totally clean. It was also inconvenient not to have any soap provided except from the dispenser in the shower stall.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Ozday
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, quiet, somewhat futuristic in furnishings, excellent value for Madrid. We did not get a chance to try their breakfasts because this does not begin before many travellers have to get back to the nearby airport. Perhaps take a few provisions unless you want to rely on a horrible coin-operated vending machine. Our taxi found the hotel slightly difficult to find since the street numbering is next to invisible and the hotel somewhat eclipsed by its more upmarket neighbour. We would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, near the airport”
Reviews.Author: URK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our way back from a 2-week trip of Europe. This is a modern, squeaky clean, hotel which appears very new. Everything in the hotel, from the lobby to the room, the furnishings, bathroom, etc. is well appointed. Very, very comfortable and about 15 minutes from the Madrid airport, the hotel has a free shuttle service to the airport (which saves you a lot of money). Obviously, the downside is that it is a bit of a hike to Madrid downtown. But my wife and I are adventurous enough to use the public transport; so, a bus (no. 77) to the nearest metro, and a 20 minute metro can take you to any place you want to visit in Madrid in 2 Euros one way per person. The staff was especially helpful with local travel advice and directions. The rates are very reasonable ($70 Euros/night with an optional breakfast for 10 Euros).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for travelers”
Reviews.Author: matar2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night of 06/30/2011. I was very pleased with the hotel a lot. The room was very clean, very calm, and looked so great. The airport shuttle is a great plus at this hotel. It runs every 30 minutes. I wanted to go the city. I was able to take the shuttle to the metro at the airport station. There are laptops hooked up to the internet in the lobby if you want to chek emails, print boarding passes, or do something else. The front desk agents spoke very good English. So, there was no issue communicating with them. I ate breakfast at the hotel. Since it was not included in the price, I paid 10 Euros. The breakfast buffet has a variety of items. You will certainly find something to eat. There is a shopping center 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel if you want to do some groceries or buy certain items.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rate, close to airport, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 20minutetourist
Reviews.Content: OK, this is not 5 star, but for a hotel close to the airport for your last night’s stay in Spain, it is perfectly functional. Do not come here if you want a restaurant, bar or room service, as there are none (although it’s slightly ritzier sister hotel right next door has a bar and a restaurant). But it does have larger than normal (European hotel) rooms, a big bathroom (shower only, no bath), and a reasonable breakfast for 10 Euro (buffet bacon & eggs, good selection of breads, sweets, fruit, etc.). Not much to see close by, but there is a hyper market and a big modern shopping mall both within 5-10 minutes’ walk. The mall has a food court with the usual suspects, plus a few Spanish-only fast food joints. For the last night at a good rate, it's perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel as well as easy access to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: denverflier
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel for 3-4 days on the end of a trans-Atlantic cruise that ended in Barcelona. This was not our first trip to Madrid and we were familiar with the hotels in the city but preferred something close to the airport to accommodate our early departure for our trip home. The Axor Feria is a new and modern hotel with most anything you want. There is a very large shopping center just a few minutes walk and you can easily access Madrid by taking the frequent shuttle back to the terminal and catching the Metro. For half the price of a city-center hotel you can have a great hotel....it just takes a little extra time to get into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with easy access to airport and downtown”
Reviews.Author: Wingkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Axor Feria so that we could have one full day in Madrid before flying back to the States after our Mediterranean cruise. It worked out great! The hotel has free airport shuttle service running every half hour so was easy to get to when we landed from Barcelona. Then, the staff directed us to a local mall for dinner in the foodcourt on Sunday night when most restaurants were closed. On Monday, they provided a city map and helped us understand our options to get in to Madrid - the easiest and least expensive of which was taking about a 10 minute bus ride to connect to the Metro. The people were all very helpful and we had a great sight-seeing day in Madrid before flying out the next morning. The shower at the hotel was excellent. The beds were hard, but they worked for weary travelers. The Axor Baraja, a 4-star, is right next door if you want to spend a little more and it has a restaurant in it (we never tried). The free wireless internet access was helpful too as we'd been on a cruise with little internet access during the previous 9 days and all three of us (my husband, teenage daughter and I) all wanted to be online at the same time with our phones/netbook.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have spent more time there! Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: melanieinsthlm
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here after a late flight from Tangiers. We had an early train the next morning to Barcelona, and I wish I had more time here to relax and enjoy the beautiful hotel! We booked it largely because of the airport shuttle but our flight was delayed and we did not make it in time. I wish that the shuttle ran later, since that is a huge perk for staying here! We ended up taking a cab, which was an added expense I really did not want! After an exhausting day, I appreciated the nice staff and the easy check-in. The rooms were clean, modern, and very comfortable; I also was thrilled about the free wifi. We paid for breakfast the next morning and it was pretty good. I explored a bit after breakfast and each floor has a different themed recreational room (video games, magazines, etc.) and I really would have liked to have more time here. The hotel called us a cab to take us to the train station. I'm not sure about public transportation links. A bit expensive if you're relying on cabs. Don't depend on the airport shuttle if you have a late flight, but overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NatalieVB
Reviews.Content: We had to overnight in Madrid to get a connecting flight on American using frequent flyer miles. I chose to stay here because of the free shuttle service to/from airport. But I was also able to go into Madrid for the afternoon using the bus and metro (only 1 euro each) without too much trouble. A short walk from the hotel to the bus stop. The price was great considering this is a new and modern hotel - very clean and comfortable, nice bathroom. Excellent breakfast. Free wi fi and computers available for use in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport with free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: MHCSB
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on its proximity to the airport and free shuttle service. The hotel is clean, very energy efficient, sleek and modern. The sister hotel immediately next door has a full restaurant and we enjoyed a nice dinner there. The grilled octapus appetizer is fabulous, as is the chocolate cake with lemon sorbet! A great place to stay if you're in transit and just need a place to sleep before catching your next flight.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value for a quick connection overnight!”
Reviews.Author: jrferreras100
Reviews.Content: Airport Transfers, Great room, quiet zone and Free WIFI near Airport, all for the Best Prize at Barajas Airport Madrid! Simply a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Axor Feria, great showers, nice rooms but need to buy an iron!”
Reviews.Author: bluedogyelloweyes
Reviews.Content: Visited the Axor Feria on business and as other reviewers I was very impressed by the shower in my room and the room itself was of a high standard, quiet and very clean. The bed was comfortable. I didn't get time to visit the gym and it is a shame there is no picture of it online anywhere so guests can see the facilities before visiting. I stayed at the Axor for 4 days and each day I requested to use the hotel iron as my clothes were creased from travelling. It was extremely disappointing that the hotel were unable to locate an iron on any of the 4 days so I ended up having to wear creased clothes for the entire business conference. I have never had this problem at any other hotel. Perhaps the Axor need to invest in some additional irons or else start to make a note of who the iron is given to so that it is possible to locate it when a guest requests it? Or install irons in each room? As a vegetarian I was very unhappy to be served with nothing more than a plate of vegetables for my evening meal. I did not mention anything at the time as I didn't want to cause a fuss in front of my colleagues. Most hotels I have stayed at the in past would serve a meal such as risotto, omelettes, salads with cheese, nut roasts - the meal usually includes some protein with it. To serve a plate of just vegetables not even in any discernable sauce or seasoning was not what I would expect from a hotel hosting an international business conference where you are bound to have a few vegetarian guests. The buffet breakfast was good and there was plenty there to suit most diets. The mini bar in the room had a rather limited selection in it and it is strange that the hotel does not have a bar and guests have to use the bar in the next door hotel which is part of the same chain. It is not far to walk to the next hotel, at least. I was surprised that there is no room service. When I arrived it would have been good to get some lunch sent up to my room or even just a drink but the only way to get a drink or some food was to go to the hotel next door. There are vending machines for soft drinks in the hotel but when I arrived I did not have any Euros and wanted to charge a meal and a drink to my room but this was not possible. I am sure many guests would appreciate a room service facility. The free wi fi was great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: patachok
Reviews.Content: After staying at all kinds of bed and breakfasts, and renting rooms and stuff, this hotel seemed amazing. Huge bathroom, the shower you can actually walk into, and walk in the shower. The bed was very comfortable, very close to the airport. The shuttle was right on schedule, so no problems there. 10Euro breakfast was good (though overpriced in my opinion). Check out a bit of a pain, but O.K. after all. So, all in all - great airport hotel. However, if you want to go to the city center - I do not recommend (or plan a 45 minute trip!)

Reviews.Title: “Close and good hotel to Barajas airport”
Reviews.Author: Las76
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious with futuristic enterior. The bathroom is huge compared to other hotels, especially the shower. The bed is ok however if you are 2 be prepared that it has two single beds put together. The fridge is automatic (you remove items and it automatically charged to your room even if you place it back) so you can not place any items there to chill or to preserve. The WIFI password is HAXOR with all capital letters (free!). The hotel is so new that my room had that new smell :-) (310). In the lobby there are 3 vending machines to buy soft drinks, coffee and sandwiches/snacks. If you walk out from the entrance and turn to your right or left (does not makes any difference - the right is 2 minutes shorter) you will find a huge mall. If you arrive in the evening it worth to go there for dinner (fast food or sit in restaurants). The transfer from the airport starts from T4 where it is parked outside the arrival next to other hotel coaches. You cant miss it as it is a brown bus with both Axor hotels name on it. Once it leaves from T4 (every half hour) it goes to T3-T2-T1 to pick up other passengers and the journey to hotel takes cca 15minutes. From the hotel it leaves from the front of the hotel' "big brother" which is just a few meters from the entrance of Feria (the 4 star one). During your check in staff will ask you whether you require a transfer back so decide what time you want to leave the hotel and take 20 minutes for the check out.

Reviews.Title: “Sexiest Airport Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: JessiWhite84
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, you should only stay here if you have a late flight into Madrid or early/midday flight out of Madrid. This is not convenient to the city -- to my best knowledge. We stayed in the city at another hotel off of Grand Via for the majority of our stay in Madrid, but wanted a convenient airport hotel for our last night before we flew out in the morning. I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and booked on booking.com. The price was only 65 Euro! With that kind of price, I was very nervous to find myself in a dump of a hotel. When we arrived, our jaws dropped. My best description is "Budget Gansevoort (NYC) Hotel." It's very modern, sexy, clean, sophisticated, and the rooms are lovely. The bathrooms are great. The beds are big. Exactly what you need to prepare for a long flight home. They have shuttles to the hotel as well, and a restaurant so you don't have to eat airport food if you want to avoid it (breakfast is not free, about 10 Euro -- wish we would have done that because we ended up paying 16 Euro at the airport for crap).

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greatone3800
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel the night before flying out of Madrid. It's definitely an excellent hotel if you looking to stay near the airport. We used the shuttle from the airport and it came within 20 minutes (you don't need to call for it). Going back to the airport, the shuttle left on time. Check-in was easy. The room were modern and clean. They have four laptops in the lobby for internet access. The room was quiet and the beds were comfortable. Bonus feature: they have a scale in the lobby for weighing your luggage (just in case you did a little too much shopping at need to make sure your bags are not overweight :) It's costs a euro, but better than paying for overweight luggage. The hotel is located about a 5 minute walk from a huge shopping mall (with grocery store and food court), so a great place to pick up some things before your flight. Great option if looking for something near airport. However, if you staying a while and doing sightseeing, this location would not be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavyF
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice, the price is good, the restaurant is outstanding, and the service is typical of anywhere in Madrid (efficient, courteous, cold). There is a free shuttle to the airport, so it's a good choice before and after a flight. But that is all. Getting into town is difficult. There is nothing here but the airport and a huge boring mall. One minor hassle is that they cater to large youth groups, which can cause some minor inconveniences and some noise. The first night I was there the groups were visible but quiet. The second night there was a lot of shouting about some sports event on TV.

Reviews.Title: “Freat Airport Hotel...free shuttle to and from”
Reviews.Author: momdadsefi2010
Reviews.Content: We book this coming back from southern Spain the night before our flight. It cost 50 euros for the night. It was extremely clean and nice. Although it has that ultra modern look and feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinderella50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before our flight out of Madrid and was quite satisfied with the choice. The free shuttle to the airport is great, we used it coming and going to the airport and it was on time and fast. Our room was comfortable - nice mattress, good clean white bedding and extra pillows. The bathroom had a huge walk in shower with rain shower head. Nice! The hotel had a room with 3 laptops available to check your email, check in at the airport, etc. There is a large shopping mall a short walk away to get some shopping in before flying out. I would recommend this clean, modern hotel as the price was excellent. There is no restaurant, but you can go next door to the sister hotel, the Axor Bajaras, for your meals.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for overnight stay near Barajas Airport, Madrid”
Reviews.Author: mps1948
Reviews.Content: We decided to use this hotel for an overnight stay on our way to Guatemala. We thus avoided having to get up at an ungodly hour to catch the 07:30 Iberia flight from LHR with connection in Madrid same day. We had our luggage checked straight through from LHR to Guatemala although we were not leaving Madrid until the next day. We were picked up by the free hotel shuttle bus from outside the terminal. I think shuttles are about every half hour each way. The hotel is only a short ride from the airport. It was one of the most comfortable hotels we have stayed in and for a very modest EUR59. An excellent buffet breakfast was an additional EUR10 per person . Excellent beds, superb shower, free wifi and room safe. All in all we couldn't have asked for more. There is a shopping centre about 5 minutes walk from the hotel with a good choice of restaurants or of course one can always take the underground train into the city centre for a greater choice of restaurants for dinner. Next day we took the free shuttle bus back to the airport and walked straight to the departure gate with our hand luggage as we already had our boarding cards for our flights.

Reviews.Title: “Great pick for airport hotel near Barajas”
Reviews.Author: untiligettobali
Reviews.Content: Really nice spacious rooms, very clean, good bedding and firm bed. Everything is new and very contemporary, a little too much so for me in fact. There is lots of common area space as well in this place, it sort of reminds me of a university campus? there are even laptop terminals for internet downstairs for free usage. Wifi in the room is excellent, there are shuttle buses to the airport every half hour, great bathrooms (huge shower with great fittings). What I don't like as much are the long, dim hallways and the pricey vending machine (great they have a vending machine but for 2.30 euros for a mars bar, I might leave it...) I paid about $60 CAD on expedia for my room and feel like it is a great room for that price. Recommend taking the shuttle and not the taxi from the airport as the shuttle is free and runs every half hour and a taxi will cost around 12-15 euros even though it's only about 4kms away. There is a mall about 7 mins walk away from the hotel, has a food court and cinema that shows only spanish dubbed movies for 7 euros I think. My non smoking room had a smoke fumes smell in it, but I asked reception for a new room and they changed it no problem. Seems like there are heaps of rooms in this hotel and high level of occupancy but rooms seem pretty sound proof. Overall a good place that is pretty much what you will expect when you see the pics and read the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Quality is far beyond what I paid for and expected”
Reviews.Author: phlip0830
Reviews.Content: This super modern style hotel is definitely a steal! The interior of hotel lobby and room is so beautiful that you cannot stop taking pictures. It could be the beautique hotel if it was in the downtown of Madrid. But, because of its location, you can enjoy the super quality with low price. (I paid about 70 euro per night) Definitely not a hotel for Madrid sightseeing. Most of the guests are, like us, who should take early flight or arrived Madrid very late. Plus, a very large shopping mall is with 5 minutes' walking distance. It is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “For one night the best option”
Reviews.Author: PriAssahida
Reviews.Content: We only stay for a night so we needed a place to stay near the airport, and that we could move fast from the hotel to airport or to the city. this hotel has a van that take you to the airport every 30 minutes and from there you can get to the city very fast!!!! There is nothing around but as we only had one day this didnt matter.

Reviews.Title: “Very affordable and comfortable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: rei-chan35
Reviews.Content: We got a great price for this hotel on Expedia and were really pleased with it. We had a one night layover in Madrid and just wanted a place to sleep, but we found the Axor Feria exceeded our expectations. Great value for money! I had read the other comments about the airport shuttle, but we booked it upon check in and had no problems whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “A new, very modern hotel perfect for a night before or after a flight”
Reviews.Author: VeroMitko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before our flight back. Our navigation system did not have any troubles in finding it. The hotel is in proximity to the Barajas airport and offers a shuttle service to the terminals. The hotel is new and very modern. The design is temporary and it resembles to a real business hotel. The hotel offers a spacious paid parking for 15 Euros a night. The staff are very helpful and efficient. The rooms are well-sized and the bathrooms are spacious and very functional. We particularly liked the white concept in the furnishing of the rooms. The hotel is not convenient if you want to use it as a starting point for a sightseeing tour of the city centre as it is a bit far from it. However, if you use it for a stop-over for a night it is just perfect. You can enjoy some shopping in the meantime in the shopping centre located nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, but a bit far away from the center”
Reviews.Author: patriot16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights during our trip to spain. the check-in was effectiv, but the staff is overall indifferent,however that is not important for us. The rooms are spacious, clean and modern, and the shower is the greatest!! The hotel has several living rooms including a room with laptops and free internet acess. There is a big mall near, and there is a big grocery shop and several restoraunts. There is also a free airport shuttle service, which was reliable and punctual. I think it`s a great place for buisness or a sleepover inbetween flights, but it was a problem for us because there is no metro station near the hotel and we wanted to go sightseeing to the center, however you can catch the 77bus to the Canilleyas metro station and then to the city, it takes about an hour all together.

Reviews.Title: “what a ripper”
Reviews.Author: walkabout777
Reviews.Content: The Axor Feria is located right next to it's 3 start brother hotel and with other airport hotels in Madrid. It is just as its website states. The rooms and the open areas are just fabulous. The shower was excellent. In the same block is a large shopping complex with a supermarket, food hall and cinema. It is a great place to stay as an overnighter before or after a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Axor Feria is far from Madris centre but offers value for money”
Reviews.Author: MrsPiket
Reviews.Content: Axor Feria opened in 2009 and is an efficient business hotel, located in Poligono Industrial Las Mercedes, an uninteresting neighbourhood full of offices close to Madrid airport. Shuttle service to the airport is complimentary. The historic centre of Madrid is quite far. Next door is the Axor Barajas hotel which is a bit more luxurious and also very good. The hotel is accessible from A2 highway but even with a GPS not easy to find. Parking in the street in front of the door is free. Staffs are correct. Axor Feria rooms are comfortable and have good beds. Decor throughout the hotel is modern and somewhat minimalistic, buffet breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cred68
Reviews.Content: Everything is fine.The Axor Feria is modern, clean, confortable and funcional.There are free wifi, free shuttle from and to Barajas airport.The rooms are big, modern decorated with very good barthroom.I recommend for everyone who would like to stay near Barajas Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, maybe a bit on the sterile side”
Reviews.Author: maguham
Reviews.Content: We have spent a day at the Axor Feria just close to the Barajas Airport due to a general strke in Spain with the result that our connecting flight on the return journey from the USA was cancelled. Thus, we were not in a favourable mood at all but have to admit that the hotel was impeccably clean almost close to sterility, though. The front desk clerk spoke perfect English and was very helpful with all informations concerning our last leg of the trip still to be accomplished . The restaurant was not in operation, unfortunately, but there was the possibility to buy snacks at the neighbouring hotel of the same chain.

Reviews.Title: “super modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: faya1234
Reviews.Content: the best hotel i've ever stayed in Europe. location is right beside the airport with excellent shuttle bus service awesome. would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Ban1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Axor Feria during last year's CPhI meeting and it was such a great experience. It has a great location for exhibitors and visitors of Feria de Madrid with two morning and one or two afternoon free transports to and from the exhibition center. However it's very far from most of Madrid's tourist attractions and it took abut 50 minutes to go to Puerta del Sol for instance by bus+metro. but they had free transport to the airport and metro station every 15 minutes I guess. As for shopping there is a good shopping center pretty close to the hotel with great resaturants. The building is quite new and stylish and the rooms are super clean and cozy. You could use free wi-fi in your room if you had a laptop and there were nice internet points with high-speed internet in different spots for those who hadn't brought their computers. Great value and a lovely place to rest after a busy day. Remember it's just next to the 4-star Axor barajas Hotel if the taxi driver couldn't find it!

Reviews.Title: “super modern and really clean”
Reviews.Author: peachy_marc
Reviews.Content: heya, me and my wife loved this hotel. it only takes 10min from the airport in a complimentary shuttle. reception was friendly and very good in english (helpful, since we don´t speak spanish). the hotel is brandnew and really modern. we loved the shower and the set up of the bathroom. also the really comfortable bed impressed us. another plus is the free wifi and the complimentary desktop computers that can be used. a shopping center (plenilunio) is in walking distance. we recommend this hotel for a late night stopover at madrid airport. the city is pretty far away (around 40min with public transportation).

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, Modern, Comfortable, and very good value”
Reviews.Author: goutdesautres
Reviews.Content: This is an airport hotel, and not at all convenient to Madrid, but it does have a free shuttle every half hour to the airport and from there you can take a subway into town. The main reason to stay at this hotel is if you are just in Madrid for a short time and want to save money. For around 65 Euros we felt we were in a pretty upscale place with free wifi internet (as well as internet cafe), lounges for group gatherings, decent TV, and a wonderful shower. Though not spacious, the room is comfortable, calm, and stylish. Another highlight is the restaurant (in the nextdoor Axor sister hotel). The lunch menu of 15 euros came with a bottle of wine, a bottle of water, good bread, appetizer (meal-sized in itself), main course, desert, and coffee. Amazing value. They don't answer their phone though, which can be a problem when you want to ask about the shuttle or change your reservation by phone

Reviews.Title: “Plush and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: darrypars
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the axor feria just for one night in transit from jerez to paris. The reason i selected this hotel in the first place was that they had a airport shuttle. travelling in a group of eight which included two senior citizens and two children below five was always going to be difficult and the airport shuttle was the best way to transport the not insignificant volume of baggage. the shuttle itself was great, the gentleman driving us helped with the luggage and accomodated us even though we were late. On arrival the axor feria was very very impressive and belonged to the new breed of no frills hotels with minimal staff yet all amenities. The check in was quick and smooth and we were accomodated on the fifth floor with adjoining rooms. the floor theme was relaxation and seeing the room gave us that. white , contemporary and chic. the bathroom was superb and belonged in a far better level hotel. We were well directed to a nearby mall which sorted out our dinner issues. The only problem was a lack of bell staff which meant that we had to carry our own bags up and down but for 49 euros a night it was outstanding The wake up call was automated and prompt and the checkout seamless.. all in all we came back wishing we spent more time there

Reviews.Title: “Nice but without fireworks”
Reviews.Author: a_guest39
Reviews.Content: Everything was OK. Shuttle in front of the airport, clean rooms, nice breakfast but hotel just like a chain one without soul. Long empty corridors, rooms without idea, although a shower really comfortable. Close to a comercial centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, shame about the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MargaretGranada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern, with clean lines - very attractive and stylish! Reception staff very efficient and friendly. Comfortable bedroom with an excellent shower. There are three computers in the lobby providing internet access. Attractive bar in the hotel next door. However, the restaurant in the hotel next door was not good. The "wild boar" with blueberry sauce, turned out to be pork with no sauce and the T-bone steak had no bone in it - it was sliced and certainly not a T-bone. The meal was also expensive for what it was. There is however a large shopping centre within a 10 minute walk where there are lots of restaurants to choose from. I would definitely recommend the hotel as it was excellent value for money, but not the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: arubiadebs
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean hotel. Airport shuttle departs every 30 minutes. Clean room with comfortable bed. Large safe. Lovely shower!! Good internet connection from the room. Average breakfast. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for layovers - not good for Madrid tourists”
Reviews.Author: BrazilBilly
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel if you need to spend the night in Madrid before a flight. The hotel is super clean, modern, convenient free shuttle, free wifi, and a restaurant for breakfast. The rooms are decent size with a medium size flat panel TV. Our room had a good view of the city. Beds are comfortable and have extra pillows. The bathrooms are brand new (as is the rest of this hotel I think) - lot of hot water, though no free shampoos (if you care). We stayed here before and after our trip to Morocco and it was a great choice both times. We did not call ahead for the shuttle - we just waited outside Terminal 2 at the airport where all the other hotel shuttles pick up and the Axor shuttle arrived. I think they run about every 30 minutes. The Axor shuttle is not listed on the list of shuttles at the bus stop, but don't worry - it will show. From the hotel, you can walk to a HUGE shopping mall in less than 10 minutes (restaurants, stores, etc), but there is nothing else around for tourists. If you are a town tourist looking to check out Madrid, this hotel is a poor choice since it is very far from tourist stuff and not on the metro lines.

Reviews.Title: “New scandanavian-influenced budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravCdn
Reviews.Content: Great new hotel near the Madrid airport. Upsides: Free shuttle runs every half hour from 10am-12midnight. It runs from the airport to the hotel (catch it at arrivals T1, just across from taxi area at Salle 2) and vice-versa (catch outside of the hotel, drop off at T1 or T2 (take the latter for the Metro)). Axor Feria is one of 2 Axor hotels, which are next door to each other. The other one is Axor Barajas, which has a restaurant for lunch and/or dinner. Restaurant in Axor Barajas, next door, was a pleasant surprise. I had a wonderful meal for dinner one night and was really quite impressed. The rate I received for my room was 59 Euro per night including breakfast each morning. The breakfast was quite good. This rate was the lowest I found when searching for hotel accommodation in Madrid. Brand new hotel, so the rooms are very clean and well appointed. Felt like the hotel was influenced by Scandanavian design. Fantastic shower! Great water pressure and beautiful design. Most front desk staff are friendly and speak English, so you can get by if you only know a bit of Spanish. Although I did not visit it, the hotel is behind Plenilunio - a large shopping mall. The downsides: I had a conference at the nearby conference centre, IFEMA, but the conference centre shuttle promoted on the hotel web site was not running as of the day I arrived there. This meant I had to take the hotel shuttle to the airport and then the metro to the conference centre. I also had to do the same route to get downtown (shuttle to airport, metro downtown). A bit of a hassle, but for the cost of the hotel it was a small inconvenience. Free wifi Internet connection, both in room and on the hotel computers, was horrid! Take a network cable to use the system in your room. This was much faster and still free.

HotelInfo.Name: Axor Feria Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Campezo 4, 28022 Madrid, Spain
